message.content:
cs.NI, cs.RO, cs.IT, cs.CV, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is the most likely category as the paper focuses on the design of a new beamforming algorithm for Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITSs) that require ultra-low end-to-end delays and multi-gigabit-per-second data transmission. 
- cs.RO (Robotics) is also likely as the paper deals with the increased mobility of Connected and Autonomous Vehicles (CAVs) and proposes a motion prediction algorithm to achieve overhead-free beamforming training. 
- cs.IT (Information Theory) is another possible category as the paper discusses the use of millimetre waves (mmWaves) communications to fulfil the requirements of ITSs. 
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is a potential category as the paper leverages CAVs sensory data to estimate their position and motion. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control) is also a possible category as the paper proposes a new algorithm to enhance the network performance of ITSs.
